TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP citizen , who was born in DATE and lives in LOC , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant filed a civil claim in ORG ( PERSON ) seeking non - pecuniary damages that he suffered in a traffic accident . The accident was allegedly caused by a member of ORG who was driving a military truck The proceedings were instituted against GPE on the basis of statutory liability for damages caused by members of ORG and , at the same time , against ORG , an insurance company from GPE , on the basis of an insurance contract .
On DATE the court gave a judgment awarding the applicant ’s claim .
On CARDINAL and DATE ORG and GPE , respectively , appealed against the judgment .
The case was forwarded to ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) as the appellate court .

On DATE ORG introduced a change of LAW which provided that all proceedings against GPE concerning actions for damages resulting from acts of members of the NORP army or police when acting in their official capacity during the Homeland War in GPE were to be stayed .
Pursuant to LAW , on DATE ORG stayed the part of the proceedings concerning the applicant ’s claim against of GPE .

The part of the proceedings concerning the applicant ’s claim for damages from ORG has not been affected by the above legislative intervention and these proceedings are pending before the appellate court upon the defendant ’s appeal .

Section CARDINAL ( a ) of the Act on Changes of LAW ( Zakon o dopunama GPE o obveznim odnosima , ORG no . CARDINAL ) provides that all proceedings instituted against GPE for damages caused by the members of the NORP army or police when acting in their official capacity during the Homeland War in GPE from DATE to DATE are to be stayed .

The LAW also imposes an obligation on the Government to submit to ORG special legislation , regulating the responsibility for such damages , at the latest within DATE from the entry into force of the Act .
